TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SocketOptionName extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines configuration option names.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SocketOptionName enumeration defines the name of each <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket> configuration option. Sockets can be configured with the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SetSocketOption%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
## Examples The following code example uses this enumeration to set socket options.
[!code-cs[Socket_Socket_Options#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.net.sockets.soc_2_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Socket_Socket_Options#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.net.sockets.soc_2_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Socket_Socket_Options#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.net.sockets.soc_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName AcceptConnection = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The socket is listening.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName AddMembership = int32(12)

Docs.summary: Add an IP group membership.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName AddSourceMembership = int32(15)

Docs.summary: Join a source group.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName BlockSource = int32(17)

Docs.summary: Block data from a source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName Broadcast = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Permit sending broadcast messages on the socket.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName BsdUrgent = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Use urgent data as defined in RFC-1222. This option can be set only once; after it is set, it cannot be turned off.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName ChecksumCoverage = int32(20)

Docs.summary: Set or get the UDP checksum coverage.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName Debug = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Record debugging information.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName DontFragment = int32(14)

Docs.summary: Do not fragment IP datagrams.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName DontLinger = int32(-129)

Docs.summary: Close the socket gracefully without lingering.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName DontRoute = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Do not route; send the packet directly to the interface addresses.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName DropMembership = int32(13)

Docs.summary: Drop an IP group membership.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName DropSourceMembership = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Drop a source group.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName Error = int32(4103)

Docs.summary: Get the error status and clear.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName ExclusiveAddressUse = int32(-5)

Docs.summary: Enables a socket to be bound for exclusive access.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName Expedited = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Use expedited data as defined in RFC-1222. This option can be set only once; after it is set, it cannot be turned off.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName HeaderIncluded = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the application provides the IP header for outgoing datagrams.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName HopLimit = int32(21)

Docs.summary: Specifies the maximum number of router hops for an Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) packet. This is similar to Time to Live (TTL) for Internet Protocol version 4.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName IPOptions = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies the IP options to be inserted into outgoing datagrams.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName IPProtectionLevel = int32(23)

Docs.summary: Enables restriction of a IPv6 socket to a specified scope, such as addresses with the same link local or site local prefix.This socket option enables applications to place access restrictions on IPv6 sockets. Such restrictions enable an application running on a private LAN to simply and robustly harden itself against external attacks. This socket option widens or narrows the scope of a listening socket, enabling unrestricted access from public and private users when appropriate, or restricting access only to the same site, as required. This socket option has defined protection levels specified in the T:System.Net.Sockets.IPProtectionLevel?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName IpTimeToLive = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Set the IP header Time-to-Live field.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName IPv6Only = int32(27)

Docs.summary: Indicates if a socket created for the AF_INET6 address family is restricted to IPv6 communications only. Sockets created for the AF_INET6 address family may be used for both IPv6 and IPv4 communications. Some applications may want to restrict their use of a socket created for the AF_INET6 address family to IPv6 communications only. When this value is non-zero (the default on Windows), a socket created for the AF_INET6 address family can be used to send and receive IPv6 packets only. When this value is zero, a socket created for the AF_INET6 address family can be used to send and receive packets to and from an IPv6 address or an IPv4 address. Note that the ability to interact with an IPv4 address requires the use of IPv4 mapped addresses. This socket option is supported on Windows Vista or later.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName KeepAlive = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Use keep-alives.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName Linger = int32(128)

Docs.summary: Linger on close if unsent data is present.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName MaxConnections = int32(2147483647)

Docs.summary: Not supported; will throw a T:System.Net.Sockets.SocketException?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName MulticastInterface = int32(9)

Docs.summary: Set the interface for outgoing multicast packets.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName MulticastLoopback = int32(11)

Docs.summary: An IP multicast loopback.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName MulticastTimeToLive = int32(10)

Docs.summary: An IP multicast Time to Live.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName NoChecksum = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Send UDP datagrams with checksum set to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName NoDelay = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Disables the Nagle algorithm for send coalescing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName OutOfBandInline = int32(256)

Docs.summary: Receives out-of-band data in the normal data stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName PacketInformation = int32(19)

Docs.summary: Return information about received packets.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName ReceiveBuffer = int32(4098)

Docs.summary: Specifies the total per-socket buffer space reserved for receives. This is unrelated to the maximum message size or the size of a TCP window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName ReceiveLowWater = int32(4100)

Docs.summary: Specifies the low water mark for Overload:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Receive?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName ReceiveTimeout = int32(4102)

Docs.summary: Receive a time-out. This option applies only to synchronous methods; it has no effect on asynchronous methods such as the M:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.BeginSend(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Net.Sockets.SocketFlags,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName ReuseAddress = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Allows the socket to be bound to an address that is already in use.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName ReuseUnicastPort = int32(12295)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the system should defer ephemeral port allocation for outbound connections. This is equivalent to using the Winsock2 SO_REUSE_UNICASTPORT socket option.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName SendBuffer = int32(4097)

Docs.summary: Specifies the total per-socket buffer space reserved for sends. This is unrelated to the maximum message size or the size of a TCP window.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName SendLowWater = int32(4099)

Docs.summary: Specifies the low water mark for Overload:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Send?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName SendTimeout = int32(4101)

Docs.summary: Send a time-out. This option applies only to synchronous methods; it has no effect on asynchronous methods such as the M:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.BeginSend(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Net.Sockets.SocketFlags,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName Type = int32(4104)

Docs.summary: Get the socket type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName TypeOfService = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Change the IP header type of the service field.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName UnblockSource = int32(18)

Docs.summary: Unblock a previously blocked source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName UpdateAcceptContext = int32(28683)

Docs.summary: Updates an accepted socket's properties by using those of an existing socket. This is equivalent to using the Winsock2 SO_UPDATE_ACCEPT_CONTEXT socket option and is supported only on connection-oriented sockets.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName UpdateConnectContext = int32(28688)

Docs.summary: Updates a connected socket's properties by using those of an existing socket. This is equivalent to using the Winsock2 SO_UPDATE_CONNECT_CONTEXT socket option and is supported only on connection-oriented sockets.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName UseLoopback = int32(64)

Docs.summary: Bypass hardware when possible.
